description: Binomial coefficients: C(n,k), 2 <= k <= n-2, sorted, duplicates removed.
comments: Complement of A137905; a(n) > A058084(a(n)). [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 20 2009]Or numbers l which, for the first time, appear in m-th row of the Laplace triangle for m<l. [From _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 28 2010]Appears to be the set of simplex numbers of order>2 and dimension>1 [From _Dylan Hamilton_, Nov 05 2010]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: Pascal's triangle (A007318) with the outer two layers removed:          6        10 10      15  20  15    21  35  35  21  28  56  70  56  2836  84 126 126  84  36...
mathematica: Take[ Union[ Flatten[ Table[ Binomial[n, k], {n, 2, 45}, {k, 2, n - 2}]]], 58] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 25 2004 *)
prog: (PARI) list(lim)=my(v=List(), t); for(n=4, sqrtint(2*lim)+1, for(k=2, n\2, t=binomial(n, k); if(t>lim, break, listput(v, t)))); vecsort(Vec(v), , 8) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 03 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Robert G. Wilson v_
extensions: Spelling corrected by _Jason G. Wurtzel_, Aug 22 2010
